channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How the Federal Reserve's rate policy affects mortgages
item.description: Quantitative tightening at the Federal Reserve may keep upward pressure on 30-year fixed mortgage rates for the foreseeable future.

item.title: ‘She is single and has a low-wage job’: I want to give my daughter, who is in her 30s, $50,000 for retirement. What could go wrong?
item.description: “She can invest aggressively, as she has over two decades to see her principal grow.”

item.title: ‘I’m betting on another 22 spins around the sun’: I’m 65 and have $3.9 million. How much should I realistically spend on a house?
item.description: “I have zero debt, no upcoming tax liabilities and no inheritance on the horizon.”

item.title: Congress avoids a shutdown but leaves 'a big mess' for Trump and Republicans in 2025
item.description: Trump tried to push Congress to take the debt ceiling off his plate but failed.

item.title: Trump taps 'Apprentice' producer, Mark Burnett, as special envoy to the United Kingdom
item.description: Television producer Mark Burnett is being tapped by President-elect Trump as special envoy to the United Kingdom in his upcoming administration.

item.title: The Quantum Leap: Understanding IonQ Inc. (IONQ)

item.title: Government shutdown crisis averted after Biden signs stopgap funding bill
item.description: President Joe Biden signed a government funding bill on Saturday that averted a government shutdown.

item.title: Innovative therapies and military tech drive early trading gains

item.title: Suspect in Germany auto attack that killed 5, injured 200 self-identified as Islamophobic and anti-immigrationist
item.description: The suspect has been identified as Taleb al-Abdulmohsen. Police have not cited a motive, but a minister confirmed that the suspect was “clearly Islamo...

item.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
item.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

item.title: I was laid off. I’m 43 and my husband is 35. I have $8,000 in credit-card debt and our mortgage is $1,600 a month. What do we do?
item.description: “We have been bringing in $60,000 a year for the last couple years, until this October, when I was laid off.”

item.title: The Quantum Leap: Understanding the Risks and Rewards of QUBT
item.description: As I sit here, sipping my morning coffee, I’m reminded that the world of finance is full of mysteries waiting to be unraveled. Take Quantum Computing ...

item.title: House Democrats say GOP caved to Musk in funding bill, protecting his China interests
item.description: The funding bill that Congress passed over the weekend could have gone further if not for Elon Musk's influence over Republicans, House Democrats say.

item.title: I spent $34,563.38 to travel the world for 18 months and tracked every cent: My budget breakdown
item.description: Here's Helen Zhao's budget breakdown by category — from lodging and transportation to food and shopping. Plus, the No. 1 thing she got for her $35,000...

item.title: ‘I worked hard for my savings’: I’m 71 and a retired teacher. I want to give my kids money — but my daughter spends lavishly and my son is wealthy.
item.description: “I have been reading about the idea of giving your children money when they need it the most, rather than waiting until you die.”

item.title: FDA approves Eli Lilly's weight loss drug Zepbound for sleep apnea, expanding use in U.S.
item.description: The agency's decision expands the use of Zepbound and could potentially pave the way for Eli Lilly to gain broader insurance coverage for the treatmen...

item.title: Elon Musk endorses far-right Alternative for Germany party in upcoming election
item.description: While he gains power in the incoming Trump administration, Elon Musk is using his influence elsewhere, endorsing a far-right party in Germany.

item.title: Car plows into Christmas market in Germany, killing at least 5 and injuring 200
item.description: Police have arrested a suspect, identified as a doctor from Saudi Arabia who lives in Germany. They have not cited a possible motive for the attack.
